content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <WMS_Capabilities version="1.3.0"   xmlns="http://www.opengis.net/wms"   xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"   xmlns:esri_wms="http://www.esri.com/wms"   xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.opengis.net/wms http://schemas.opengis.net/wms/1.3.0/capabilities_1_3_0.xsd http://www.esri.com/wms http://coast.noaa.gov/arcgis/services/MarineCadastre/OceanWaveResourcePotential/MapServer/WmsServer?version=1.3.0%26service=WMS%26request=GetSchemaExtension">   <Service>     <Name><![CDATA[WMS]]></Name>     <Title><![CDATA[Ocean Wave Resource Potential]]></Title>     <Abstract><![CDATA[Mean wave power density estimates represent naturally available US wave energy, derived from measurements observed during a 51-month study period. Measurements were taken from 42,000 grid points out to a distance of 50 nautical miles from shore. Values represent the average instantaneous power generated by a meter length of wave crest per grid point. In accordance with accepted global practice, wave power density is measured in kilowatts per meter of wave crest aggregated across a unit diameter circle. Data were classified using quantiles. Bathymetric effects are known to have a large effect on wave characteristics at depths shallower than ~20m on the east coast and ~50m on the west coast. Reliable site-specific information in shallow waters can only be produced using results from models with higher spatial resolution that include shallow-water physics. Results may not be accurate in the shallower waters of the inner continental shelf. These areas are indicated by dark gray regions. For more information pertaining to these areas please refer back to the source.]]></Abstract>     <KeywordList><Keyword><![CDATA[Oceans, Marine, National, Renewable energy, offshore, NOAA OCM, BOEM]]></Keyword></KeywordList>     <OnlineResource xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" xlink:type="simple" <Title><![CDATA[Ocean Wave Resource Potential]]></Title>         <Abstract><![CDATA[Data depicts mean wave power density within U.S. waters.  Estimates represent naturally available U.S. wave energy, derived from measurements observed during a 51-month study period.  Measurements were taken from 42,000 grid points out to a distance of 50 nautical miles from shore.  Values represent the average instantaneous power generated by a meter length of wave crest per grid point.  In accordance with accepted global practice, wave power density is measured in kilowatts per meter (kW/m) of wave crest aggregated across a unit diameter circle.  These data were classified using quantiles.]]></Abstract> <CRS>CRS:84</CRS> <CRS>EPSG:4326</CRS> <CRS>EPSG:3857</CRS>  <!-- alias 3857 --> <CRS>EPSG:102100</CRS> <EX_GeographicBoundingBox><westBoundLongitude>-179.999989</westBoundLongitude><eastBoundLongitude>179.997760</eastBoundLongitude><southBoundLatitude>16.833300</southBoundLatitude><northBoundLatitude>63.020600</northBoundLatitude></EX_GeographicBoundingBox> <BoundingBox CRS="CRS:84" minx="-179.999989" miny="16.833300" maxx="179.997760" maxy="63.020600"/> <BoundingBox CRS="EPSG:4326" minx="16.833300" miny="-179.999989" maxx="63.020600" maxy="179.997760"/> <BoundingBox CRS="EPSG:3857" minx="-20037507.067200" miny="1901428.771100" maxx="20037258.987200" maxy="9105303.856500"/>         <Style>           <Name>default</Name>           <Title>0</Title>           <LegendURL width="220" height="192">             <Format>image/png</Format>             <OnlineResource xlink:href="http://coast.noaa.gov/arcgis/services/MarineCadastre/OceanWaveResourcePotential/MapServer/WmsServer?request=GetLegendGraphic%26version=1.3.0%26format=image/png%26layer=0" xlink:type="simple" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" />           </LegendURL>         </Style>       </Layer>     </Layer>   </Capability> </WMS_Capabilities>
